title: Language-Based Self-Directed Learning Course for Enhancing Disaster Management Literacy Competencies (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational disaster management theory and field experience, basic ability to analyze disaster-related texts and synthesize information, and possession of basic grammar comprehension and reading/writing skills
context.additional_context: Aims to enhance disaster response language literacy (reading/writing/expression) and digital content utilization skills for in-service elementary teachers. Particularly focuses on disaster manual interpretation, situation report writing, and student-oriented explanatory material creation, while strengthening vocabulary expansion and text structure analysis abilities.

learning_goals: Learners search for suitable text/video content in DMLH with ≥80% accuracy using disaster management-related professional vocabulary (keywords) and extract core information through contextual analysis

Learners curate a personalized disaster management content dashboard using the "bookmark feature," systematically categorize key information (expressions/data/statistics), and reorganize information based on reading comprehension skills

Learners produce a scenario project (3 stages: preparation–response–recovery) using ≥5 out of ≥10 collected disaster response-related contents via the "binder feature," submit deliverables (report/presentation) meeting ≥5 out of 7 institutional evaluation checklist items, and apply clear expression strategies using writing skills

resources: DMLH (Digital Media Learning Hub) platform access rights

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
